it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller

Class PersistentViewImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.observer.RemoteObservable<ViewEvent>
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.PersistentViewImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewEventVisitor, RemoteView, RemoteObserver<ModelUpdate>, PersistentView, Remote

    public class PersistentViewImpl
extends RemoteObservable<ViewEvent>
implements PersistentView
    Implementation of PersistentView by decorating RemoteView Uses a RequestManager to handle requests to the user and a ScheduledExecutorService for the timer. By convention, if the remote view has connection faults, it gets set to null
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer(Callable<?> callback,
                       long delay,
                       TimeUnit unit)
        Starts a timer for this particular player. If a timer is running, this will stop it and start the new one
        Specified by:
        startTimer in interface PersistentView
        Parameters:
        callback - the function that will be called when the timer expires, not null
        delay - the duration of the timer
        unit - the time unit for delay
        Throws:
        RejectedExecutionException - – if the task cannot be scheduled for execution
        NullPointerException - – if callback is null

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stops the running timer. If there is no running timer, it does nothing
        Specified by:
        stopTimer in interface PersistentView

      • isTimerRunning

        public boolean isTimerRunning()
        Checks if the timer is running
        Specified by:
        isTimerRunning in interface PersistentView
        Returns:
        true if the timer is running, false if not

      • disconnectRemoteView

        public void disconnectRemoteView()
        Forces the disconnection of the internal remote view, if it is connected. The disconnection is then treated as a network fault
        Specified by:
        disconnectRemoteView in interface PersistentView

      • reconnectRemoteView

        public boolean reconnectRemoteView(RemoteView view)
        Substitutes the remote view of the player with the provided one. In detail:
        • If network faults have already been detected, the substitution is guaranteed
        • If network faults have not been detected, a ping is sent to the client to detect network problems. If the ping doesn't succeed, the reconnection happens; if it does succeed, then the reconnection doesn't happen
        Specified by:
        reconnectRemoteView in interface PersistentView
        Parameters:
        view - the view of the player who wants to reconnect
        Returns:
        true if reconnection goes fine, false otherwise

      • setReconnectionCallback

        Sets the function to be called when a reconnection happens
        Specified by:

      • hasNetworkFault

        public boolean hasNetworkFault()
        Returns if a network fault has been detected with the remote. Note that this does not try to contact the remote to check connectivity, but reports if a network fault has been detected in previous method calls
        Specified by:
        hasNetworkFault in interface PersistentView
        Returns:
        if a network fault has been detected

      • sendChoiceRequest

        public <T extends Serializable> CompletableChoice<T> sendChoiceRequest(ChoiceRequest<T> request)
        Sends a request to the player and returns an object that can be used to retrieve the response to that request. If the request is not accepted by the RequestManager, or if the user is disconnected this returns a pre-cancelled CompletableChoice
        Specified by:
        sendChoiceRequest in interface PersistentView
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of choices
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be sent, not null
        Returns:
        a completable choice which can be used to retrieve the user's choice

        public String getUsername()
        Returns the username of the player associated with this view. It returns null if the username has not already been set (prior to login)
        Specified by:
        getUsername in interface RemoteView
        Specified by:
        getUsername in interface PersistentView
        Returns:
